text: Tagetes hartwegii is a Mexican species of marigolds in the sunflower family. It is endemic to the states of Jalisco and Nayarit in western Mexico.Turner, B. L. 1996. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 6. Tageteae and Athemideae. Phytologia Memoirs 10: i–ii, 1–22, 43–93 ==Description== Tagetes hartwegii is a hairless perennial herb up to 90 cm (3 feet) tall. Stem is woody at the base. Leaves are bipinnate, up to 8 cm (3.2 inches) long. Flower heads are yellow-orange, each containing 8 ray florets and 35-40 disc florets.Greenman, Jesse More 1904. Proceedings of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences 40: 46-47 ==References== ==External links== hartwegii Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Jalisco Category:Flora of Nayarit Category:Plants described in 1904
title: Tagetes hartwegii
